text.p: Following are the main stories in Tuesday's Malaysian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-- State investment fund Permodalan Nasional CEO Mohd Hilmey Mohd said he was not aware of any deal to sell its stake in vehicle concern UMW Holdings Bhd.
-- The Securities Commission will unveil its draft framework for over-the-counter trading on February 18, SC chairman Munir Abdul Majid said.
-- Islamic opposition party PAS has won a by-election in Pulai Chondong in eastern Kelantan state, by a slim 188 votes.
-- Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad said the government would have to seek sources of funds to pay off debt owed by state-owned steelmaker Perwaja Steel Sdn Bhd.
-- Development work at a 40-hectare site which is the focus of an Anti-Corruption Agency investigation has been halted pending an environmental impact study.
-- The Home Ministry is setting up 16 special squads to spearhead the nationwide swoop on illegal foreign workers, Deputy Home Affairs Minister Megat Junid Megat Ayob said.
